intro: Pelargonium incrassatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and clusters of small, pink to red flowers. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to bloom throughout the growing season. Pelargonium incrassatum is also valued for its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
